item.title: Sofitel SO Bangkok announces the chef lineup for So Amazing Chefs 2015
item.description: Source: Sofitel SO Bangkok.Â The Sofitel SO Bangkok has announced that 12 world-renowned chefs will be in Thailand for the 4th So Amazing Chefs event, happening from October 6th to 11th, 2015. Yves Mudry, General Manager of Sofitel SO Bangkok shared, “This year’s food festival is our most prestigious yet, featuring an incredible lineup of chefs with a combined seven Michelin stars. This event highlights Bangkok’s status as a culinary destination and fosters the exchange of culinary ideas and inspiration.

item.title: Experience a unique twist on French-inspired dining this holiday season at Sofitel So Singapore
item.description: Source: Sofitel So Singapore. Paulo. At Sofitel So Singapore, Xperience restaurant’s head chef, Trevor Paulo, is celebrating his first Christmas season at the hotel with a special four-course Christmas Eve dinner. The dinner starts with a small bite of blinis topped with dill yogurt and herring roe. The first course is a visually appealing dish of house-cured Salmon Gravlax arranged to look like a miniature garden with edible truffle “soil” and pickled shallots.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Adjusting the Sub-Chassis and the Platter, and RPM Calibration
item.description: Today was dedicated to adjusting the platter and sub-chassis on a Beogram 4002 (5513) that I’m working on. I aimed to align the platter’s aluminum surface with the surrounding panels, center the sub-chassis within the transport locks’ limits, and ensure the arms were parallel to the aluminum surfaces. It’s intricate work involving aligning numerous components. After gaining experience with this process, I achieved a satisfactory result, aligning the Beogram to specifications.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Repair of a Broken SO ('Shut Off') Switch
item.description: This post continues the discussion about a malfunctioning “Shut Off” (SO) switch, which was missing a crucial plastic part, causing issues with the deck’s shutdown process. To address this, a 3D printed replacement part was designed and created. The “End Switch” (ES), still equipped with its plastic component, is pictured alongside the SO switch, highlighting the missing element. Creating a functional replacement part was challenging due to its small size and the limitations of the 3D printer.
